## 판결문 요약


254 Md. 303 (1969)
255 A.2d 376
MAYOR AND CITY COUNCIL OF BALTIMORE, ET AL.
v.
SITNICK, T/A HILTON HOUSE, ET AL.
MAYOR AND CITY COUNCIL OF BALTIMORE, ET AL.
v.
FIREY, ET AL. T/A CONGRESS HOTEL COMPANY
[No. 295, September Term, 1968.] [No. 297, September Term, 1968.]
Court of Appeals of Maryland.
Decided June 27, 1969.
Motions for rehearing filed July 25 and 28, 1969.
Denied September 8, 1969.
*306 The cause was argued before HAMMOND, C.J., and MARBURY, McWILLIAMS, FINAN and SINGLEY, JJ.
Ambrose T. Hartman, Deputy City Solicitor, and Gerald S. Klein, Assistant City Solicitor, with whom was George L. Russell, Jr., City Solicitor, on the brief, for appellants.
D. Duffy Herman, with whom were A. David Gomborov and Gomborov, Steinberg & Schlachman on the brief, for appellees in No. 295.
Benjamin N. Dorman for appellees in No. 297.
FINAN, J., delivered the opinion of the Court.
These two appeals[1] were consolidated by the lower court and present the question of the validity of Ordinance Nos. 370, 491, 739 and 1219, now comprising Article 19, Sections 51 through 61 of the Baltimore City Code (1966 Ed.), as amended, enacted by the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore to establish minimum wage standards for certain private employments within the City's jurisdiction.
